question: Who will be the new under-secretary General of the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)?
explanation: Mark Lowcock, the head of Britain\'s international development department, will be the new Under-secretary General of the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA). He will succeed Stephen O’Brien, who held the post for two years. He will be tasked with leading the UN’s struggling relief efforts in Syria along with major aid operations in South Sudan, Yemen, Iraq, the Central African Republic and the Lake Chad region.
